Context:
Program Name: Construction Craft Worker Foundations
Code: A106
Credential: Ontario College Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 18 weeks
Starting Months: April
Location: Casa Loma Campus
Program Includes: classroom and construction lab instruction, 160 hours of work placement, and workshops.
Program Availability (Domestic Students):
- Fall 2024: Not Available
- Winter 2025: Not Available
- Spring 2025: Opening Soon
Collaborators: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH)
Description: Free, supported education program for students with mental health and/or addiction challenges to gain skills for entry-level work in Toronto's construction industry.

Context:
Program Name: Construction Craft Worker Program
Duration: 18 weeks long
Start Date: April (full-time delivery)
Class and construction lab time per week: 30 to 35 hours
Work placement and workshops hours: 160 hours
Certificate Received: Ontario College Certificate
Career Options: construction laborer, carpentry helper, masonry helper, cement-finishing helper, demolition worker, retail area of the construction sector
Required Courses: BLDG 1058 - Plans, Specifications and Calculations, BLDG 1059 - Construction Site Safety, Tools and Equipment, BLDG 1060 - Concrete Work, Scaffolding and Hoisting, BLDG 1061 - Construction Site Works, BLDG 1062 - Industry Practicum, COUN 1033 - Field Integration, FAID 1003 - Standard First Aid, MATH 1100 - Foundation Math for Building Technologies, MATH 1109 - Mathematics for Building Technologies, WELD 1005 - Metal Cutting
Learning Outcomes: operation of tools and equipment safely, selection of appropriate material types, application of Ontario Building Code and Occupational Health and Safety Act regulations, identification of unsafe conditions, interpretation of orthographical projected drawings, application of construction processes to residential/commercial construction and renovations, problem-solving.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Construction Craft Worker Foundations Program A106 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context: This program is a free construction-focused offering at George Brown College that does not qualify for OSAP funding. The admission requirements include an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, mental health and/or addictions history, mature student status (19 years of age or older), application completion, academic assessment, skills assessment, and interview. No course exemptions are available due to the block format nature of the program. To apply, applicants can download the application package, call the Augmented Education office at 415-416-5000 ext. 6790, or email a request to auged@georgebrown.ca. The contact information for French services is 416-415-5000, poste 3111 or frenchserviceinfo@georgebrown.ca. For more information about George Brown College, applicants can contact the Contact Centre at 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002. The program covers construction processes, problem-solving techniques in various construction scenarios, welding equipment usage, and emergency scene management with basic first aid.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Construction Craft Worker Foundations Program A106 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context: Construction Craft Worker Foundations program is taught at George Brown's Casa Loma Campus located at 160 Kendal Ave., Toronto, Ontario. Information sessions and campus tours can be booked online. Related programs include Construction Techniques (T176), Practical Nursing (PN) (S121), and Carpentry and Renovation Technician (T180). Prospective students can sign up to receive tailored resources for their application process. The form requires the user's first name, last name, email address, and whether they are domestic or international students along with their country of origin. Users must agree to receive email communications from George Brown College. Contact number: 800-265-2002.
